poem:
Glass Skin

In the morning paper,
an opal face gazes up,
the promise of glass skin.
Britons forsake their tea,
tighten their belts,
yearning for that unblemished light.
Here we are,
polishing our reflections
until we vanish
in the sheen
of another's dream.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Promise of ‘glass skin’ drives surge in sales of K-beauty products in UK We’ve had South Korean pop, film, fashion and food, and now the latest trend is K-beauty, with sales of Korean skincare brands taking off in the UK as consumers are seduced by products that promise to conjure a radiant complexion. Britons are cutting back in other areas, but they are still chasing what the beauty industry describes as the “glass skin” look,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
